text:
Nicanor Parra Sandoval (5 September 1914 – 23 January 2018) was a Chilean poet, mathematician and physicist. He was considered to be an influential poet in Latin America and one of the most important poets of Spanish literature. Parra had been nominated several times for a Nobel Prize in Literature.
Parra died on January 23, 2018, at 7:00 am, in La Reina, Chile, at the age of 103.
